summary: The Family and Medical Insurance Leave Act (FAMILY Act) proposes to establish a national paid family and medical leave program. It creates the Office of Paid Family and Medical Leave within the Social Security Administration to administer benefits.  Eligible individuals with qualifying reasons (including caregiving, serious health conditions, and family violence) can receive benefits. The bill outlines benefit amounts, eligibility requirements, and application procedures. It funds a State administration option for legacy States. It also includes employment and benefit protections. The Comptroller General is required to study the benefits paid under this act.
